_comment: This is a template for adding a new movement to movements.json
_instructions: Copy this entire object and paste it into the 'movements' array in movements.json
title: Your Movement Name
description: A brief 1-2 sentence description of the movement that appears in the collapsed card view.

context.historical: What was happening in the world during this period? Major historical events, social changes, technological developments.
context.philosophical: What fundamental questions did this movement explore? What themes and ideas were writers grappling with?
context.literary: What narrative techniques or literary innovations did this movement introduce? What was unique about the writing style?
context.scientific: What scientific concepts, technologies, or theories were central to this movement? What 'what if' questions about science?
context.themes: What recurring themes, motifs, or topics appear across works in this movement?

influence.desc: Brief description of how this movement influenced the other

reaction.desc: Brief description of how this movement rejected or reacted against the other

evolution.desc: Brief description of how this movement evolved from the other

related.desc: Brief description of how these movements are related or parallel

_notes.id: Must be unique, lowercase, use hyphens (e.g., 'cli-fi', 'cyberpunk')
_notes.title: The display name shown on cards
_notes.year: Single number used for timeline positioning (center of period)
_notes.gender: Must be 'M' or 'F' - used for author statistics and highlighting
_notes.favorite: Optional boolean - adds star to author
_notes.connections: All connection types are optional. Connection 'to' must reference valid movement IDs
